entry.title: Editing latex documents in emacs
entry.content: NEW YEAR, new me. Now is a pretty good time to get your CVs and similar documents up to date. I wanted to have a play with typesetting it in Latex. Being a pretty lazy person, I quickly tired of the workflow of making a small change,...

entry.title: Spellchecking in emacs
entry.content:
EMACS IS gorgeously extensive, but there is very little hand-holding. Short of packages like Spacemacs, it provides very little functionality out of the box. A pretty basic function of a editor is spellchecking. Fortunately, it's fairly simple matter to set it up.

Check Flycheck is...

entry.title: Not for you
entry.content: THIS IS not for you, or so goes the dedication line for Mark Z. Danielewski's House of Leaves. It's a fantastic line that creeps me out a little. It both acknowledges the reader, but also establishes a sense of hostility with them. You're here, but you really...

entry.title: Making your emacs config a little more literate
entry.content: EMACS IS an incredible application, more text interface than editor. Like an old baseball glove, it slowly molds to the user's hand over a period of many years. This is achieved by keeping a .emacs settings file. The user edits this file with all their customizations -...

entry.title: Building a better Building 20
entry.content: I'VE ALWAYS enjoyed the idea of being able to take something as chaotic and ill-defined as creative genius, and build a machine to produce it. There's something satisfying about the mechanisms of a machine. Each part achieves its purpose because it has no choice but to be...
